metadata.case_name: M/s. Muller & Phipps India Ltd. v. K. C. Sud

facts.text: Sud was a workman of the appellant company, M/s. Muller & Phipps India Ltd.
Sud was retrenched by the company on January 31, 1958.

At the time of retrenchment, a reference on the question of introduction of a gratuity scheme for the workmen of the company was pending before the Industrial Tribunal, with reference dated June 28, 1957.
An application by Sud against the order of retrenchment under S. 33A failed.

The Industrial Tribunal made an award framing a gratuity scheme applicable from June 28, 1957: On death or incapacity, half a month's basic salary or wages for each year of continuous service to employee/heirs; on voluntary retirement/resignation after five years, same; on termination of service by the company, half a month's basic salary or wages for each year of completed service.

Sud made an application under s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act claiming gratuity under the award, as retrenchment amounted to termination of service; he had completed two years of service; basic wage at retrenchment Rs. 80.42 np.
Labour Court, Delhi, in L.C.A. No. 53/1959 dated May 18, 1959, computed amount due to Sud by way of gratuity as Rs. 80.42 np.
Sud had already received retrenchment compensation in accordance with s. 25F of the Industrial Disputes Act.

legal_issues.text: Whether the respondent is entitled to recover gratuity under the scheme in addition to the compensation already received under s. 25F of the Industrial Disputes Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Gratuity claimed is in essence the same as compensation for retrenchment; allowing gratuity in addition to s. 25F compensation would give double benefit for the same event (retrenchment), which is unfair to the employer and against the Industrial Disputes Act.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 25F of the Industrial Disputes Act

respondent_arguments.text: Retrenchment amounted to termination of service within the meaning of the award; entitled to half a month's basic salary for each year of completed service (Rs. 80.42 np. for two years).
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Gratuity scheme under Industrial Tribunal award; s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act

court_reasoning.text: Gratuity under schemes is a retirement benefit to help after retirement whatever the cause; retrenchment compensation under s. 25F is relief for sudden termination to tide over unemployment; nothing in law prevents double benefit unless scheme provides otherwise; depends on construction of scheme terms.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cited Indian Hume Pipe Co. v. Its Workers for general principle allowing double benefit.

court_reasoning.text: In Brahmachari Research Institute v. Its Workmen, gratuity for retrenchment as such was in lieu of s. 25F; distinguished here as no specific provision for retrenchment; scheme covers termination by company generally, without distinguishing retrenchment.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Reasonable conclusion: gratuity intended in addition to s. 25F compensation, not in lieu.

court_reasoning.text: Workmen urged distinct provision for retrenchment but Tribunal provided for three classes without special retrenchment clause; retrenchment falls under termination but gratuity additional.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Labour Court right in holding entitlement to gratuity despite s. 25F payment.

holdings.text: Gratuity under the award is distinct from and in addition to retrenchment compensation under s. 25F; respondent entitled to gratuity of Rs. 80.42 np.

precedents_cited.case_name: Indian Hume Pipe Co. v. Its Workers
precedents_cited.relevance: Gratuity and retrenchment compensation have different objects; double benefit permissible unless scheme provides otherwise; construction of scheme terms decisive.

precedents_cited.case_name: Brahmachari Research Institute v. Its Workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Gratuity specifically for retrenchment as such was in lieu of s. 25F; differs from present award lacking specific retrenchment provision.

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act
statutes_cited.relevance: s. 33C(2) for recovery of gratuity under award; s. 33A application failed; s. 25F retrenchment compensation received; gratuity additional unless scheme specifies lieu.

outcome.summary: Appeal against Labour Court order granting Rs. 80.42 np. gratuity dismissed; held respondent entitled to gratuity under Tribunal award in addition to s. 25F retrenchment compensation.

key_quotes.text: "the gratuity which the respondent claims on the basis of the award is distinct from and in addition to the retrenchment compensation he has received."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "there was nothing in law to prevent a workman from getting double benefit, one under a gratuity scheme and the other as retrenchment compensation."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Principle from Indian Hume Pipe case applied.
